title: Drawing, "Design for a Coffee Pot", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite, on verso, white and yellow pastel on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at center right: 44
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: CAFETIERE (C)/DIAMETRE 10 cms/HAUTEUR 14 cms 1/2; at lower center right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/10.41; to the right of the handle: IVOIRE; to the right of the coffeepot: VERMEIL; in graphite at lower right: hormas de falsos con clave; at lower left: [mathematical notations].
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Pear-shaped coffeepot with flared spout drawn in plan and elevation with an applied scalloped-edged lower body indicated in yellow pastel to be executed in vermeil. Hinged lid surmounted by a short stem-form finial and attached C-scroll handle indicated in white pastel to be executed in ivory. Raised on a short flaring foot. Placement of screws and hinge indicated by circles on finial and upper handle. Underdrawing in graphite of coffeepot in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains two archival photographs of coffeepot, Box 8, Folder 1 "Coffeepots," #44.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 44.
